item.title: Windows run.exe to linux run.exe help?
item.dc:creator: @Teem_Rocket Teem_Rocket
item.description:
@Teem_Rocket wrote:

borisbink007:

well i have no idea how to do that cmn anyone make from my java code a linux code plz i takes 2mins for people who knows what there doing.

You can use a program which will enable you to use your Batch files. Also remember that your names are case-sensitive. I don’t use Linux but perhaps someone will post their initiator contents.

Read full topic

item.source: Windows run.exe to linux run.exe help?

item.title: Windows run.exe to linux run.exe help?
item.dc:creator: @Samih1996 Samih1996
item.description:
@Samih1996 wrote:

on windows, usually is called the run.bat file. there is no exe file to run the game client, and for linux its run.sh and you never have ‘set lib’ in a run.bat file i never seen this. but you can try renaming the file to run.sh

and once you rename replace everything with:

set lib=%lib%bin:
set lib=%lib%deps/castlewars.jar:
set lib=%lib%deps/collisionmap.jar:
set lib=%lib%deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar:
set lib=%lib%deps/jython.jar:
set lib=%lib%deps/mysql-connector-java-5.1.6-bin.jar:
set lib=%lib%deps/xstream.jar:
set lib=%lib%deps/mina.jar:
set lib=%lib%deps/mysql.jar:
set lib=%lib%deps/poi.jar:
set lib=%lib%deps/slf4j.jar:
set lib=%lib%deps/slf4j-nop.jar:
set lib=%lib%deps/netty.jar:

java -Xmx800m -cp %lib% server.Server
pause

or keep it exactly the same but remove the title and echo off.

if it doesn’t work, you’ll need someone else. i am just taking a guess, since someone else had a similar issue they had to change every ; to : and not include echo off and title in the code (whatever u want to call it).

I personally recommend u remove the set lib stuff.

Read full topic
item.source: Windows run.exe to linux run.exe help?

item.title: Windows run.exe to linux run.exe help?
item.dc:creator: @kingman002 kingman002
item.description:
@kingman002 wrote:

Why would you get a linux vps if you use windows?

Linux can’t use Batch files or Exe files

Read full topic

item.title: Windows run.exe to linux run.exe help?
item.dc:creator: @borisbink007 borisbink007
item.description:
@borisbink007 wrote:

I need help with the server run.exe to host my server on my linux vps here is my run code, i got java jdk 6u24 and screen installed on my vps i hope someone can help me thanks.

@echo off
title allstarlegends

set lib=%lib%bin;
set lib=%lib%deps/castlewars.jar;
set lib=%lib%deps/collisionmap.jar;
set lib=%lib%deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;
set lib=%lib%deps/jython.jar;
set lib=%lib%deps/mysql-connector-java-5.1.6-bin.jar;
set lib=%lib%deps/xstream.jar;
set lib=%lib%deps/mina.jar;
set lib=%lib%deps/mysql.jar;
set lib=%lib%deps/poi.jar;
set lib=%lib%deps/slf4j.jar;
set lib=%lib%deps/slf4j-nop.jar;
set lib=%lib%deps/netty.jar;

“C:\Program Files\Java\jre7\bin\java.exe” -Xmx800m -cp %lib% server.Server
pause

i tryd mzking it for linux but i faild
can someone correct it for me thanks.

screen -A -m -d -S rsps java -classpath bineps/castlewars.jareps/collisionmap.jareps/log4j-1.2.15.jareps/jython.jareps/mysql-connector-java-5.1.6-bin.jareps/xstream.jareps/mina.jareps/mysql.jareps/poi.jareps/slf4j.jareps/slf4j-nop.jareps/netty.jar: %lib% server.Server

Read full topic
